snippet: As Myanmar opens up to the world, foreign investors describe the country as a new frontier. But many worry about a lack of skilled labor, crumbling infrastructure and surprisingly high prices.
abstract: Myanmar is an untapped market for foreign investors and investment banks that ignored the country during decades of military rule; many people who work in Myanmar, however, say they are worried the country's underlying problems could stall or limit growth.

byline.contributor: Poypiti Amatatham contributed reporting from Bangkok.

lead_paragraph: As Myanmar opens up to the world, foreign investors describe the country as a new frontier. But many worry about a lack of skilled labor, crumbling infrastructure and surprisingly high prices.

headline.seo: Myanmar Faces Stumbling Blocks on Way to Growth
headline.main: After Decades of Limits, Myanmar Offers Riches
headline.print_headline: After Decades of Limits, Myanmar Offers Riches
